column2: Skill required:  Sourcing & Procurement - Procurement Management Designation:  Business Advisory New Associate Qualifications: BCom/Any Graduation/Master of Business Administration  Years of Experience: 0 to 1 years  Language - Ability: English - Intermediate  What would you do? Go beyond processing purchase orders at lower costs to help clients reap savings and value from the billions they spend on the goods and services that run their day-to-day business operations. You will be working as a part of Procurement management team which uses a systematic approach for buying all the goods and services needed for a company to stay sustainable. They are involved in the identification of need, finding and qualifying the suppliers, requesting proposals, negotiating with suppliers, contracting, delivery and analyzing results.The Procurement Support team focuses on identifying the requirements for goods and services from all business units. The team is responsible for identifying and evaluating a list of suppliers, negotiating contracts with the selected supplier, raising a purchase requisition and releasing the purchase order. The team is also responsible for completing the payment process upon receiving an invoice, auditing the delivery of requested goods/services and maintaining proper records of invoices. What are we looking for? Procurement Operations Procurement Support Ability to perform under pressure Agility for quick learning Commitment to quality Sourcing Spot Buy Sourcing  Roles and Responsibilities: In this role you are required to solve routine problems, largely through precedent and referral to general guidelines Your primary interaction is within your own team and your direct supervisor In this role you will be given detailed instructions on all tasks The decisions that you make impact your own work and are closely supervised You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team with a predetermined, narrow scope of work Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts Qualification BCom,Any Graduation,Master of Business Administration
column11: procurement management, sourcing, business administration, procurement, business operations, project management, operations management, team management, business development, sales, marketing, b2b sales, lead generation, key account management

column2: Skill required: Procurement management - Procurement Support Designation: Management Level - Team Lead/Consultant Job Location: Bengaluru Qualifications: Any Graduation Years of Experience: 7 to 11 years What would you do? The workplace category is responsible for ensuring Accenture has the best working environments for our colleagues to excel. Workplace will include the following sub-categories:Real Estate Projects & Fitouts; Office Equipment; Office Services; catering; Utilities, Facilities Maintenance; and Security. The Workplace Sourcing & Contracting Specialist is responsible for supporting the delivery of services to stakeholders and category leads including but not limited to strategic sourcing, competitive bids, contract negotiations, supplier performance management, price management, savings/compliance reporting, continuous improvement and ongoing cost reductions, supply market monitoring, and issue resolution What are we looking for? Skills and Experience: Bachelor's degree Minimum of 5 years' experience in strategic sourcing, contract negotiations, procurement and supplier management. Proven knowledge of Procurement methodology and sourcing execution with demonstrated success negotiating complex purchasing agreements in this category Ability to manage multiple projects, adopt a flexible approach and prioritize tasks appropriately Comfortable navigating and communicating in a multicultural and broad environment and with all levels of the organization Strong stakeholder management, relationship building, and communication skills aligned to a proactive customer-focused approach Forward and solution minded, team player and with high degree of self-management Comfortable working in a matrix type organization Ability to coach/mentor and lead if required; ability to collaborate, advocate a shared vision, and execute with agility Ability to travel 10% of time. Required Skills Excellent communication skills - written and verbal including formal presentation skills. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Strong multi-tasking skills. Strong multi-phase project management skills. Attention to detail, able to problem solve, analytical. Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Word. Adaptable communication ability to conform to the varied corporate cultures and organizational structures of our customers Language:English Roles and Responsibilities Key accountabilities: The Workplace Sourcing & Contracting Specialist will: Lead sourcing exercises including RFIs and RFPs in the delivery of the category strategy and market unit objectives Lead upfront market research and supplier identification for category projects Business partner stakeholders to ensure delivery is aligned to procurement and stakeholder objectives Work collaboratively with suppliers and stakeholders to lead, communicate and support sourcing and category management activities Provide analysis for necessary sourcing activities to maintain the competitiveness of category contracts Build trusted partnerships with our supplier panel to deliver our strategy and market unit objectives Manage KPI reporting of supplier performance, and identify opportunities for data to improve the delivery of our category strategy Perform total cost of ownership analyses for the evaluation of continuous cost improvement projects Gather monthly performance-related data and prepare executive reports and presentations Support supply market research for your category Support sales & business development, spend & contract analysis, and category planning activities Perform numerous complex problem-solving functions to ensure customer satisfaction with Accenture's services Ensure communication flows between the relevant functions at a local and global level that are involved in delivering the category strategy Develop excellent working relationships with customer stakeholders at both the corporate and business unit level Support P2P processes as required in delivery of procurement services to key category stakeholders. Proactively present recommendations for efficiency, innovative ideas, cost optimisation strategies, and new ways of working to the customer/stakeholder in an advisory capacity Qualificationunavailable
column11: contract negotiations, project management, relationship building, strategic sourcing, stakeholder management, procurement management, management skills, kpi, presentation skills, supplier management, sourcing, procurement, performance management

column1: Business Operations Associate - Supply chain engineering service
column2: Skill required:Supply chain engineering service - Mechanical Engineering  Designation:Management Level - Associate  Job Location:Mumbai  Qualifications:Advance Diploma In Mechanical / Manufacturing Engineering  Years of Experience:1 to 3 years  What would you do? You will be aligned with our Supply Chain and Operations vertical and help us in the system of organizations, people, activities, information, and resources involved in moving a product or service from supplier to customer. The Supply chain engineering service team will be involved in ensuring that the equipment attributes are updated and attached to a maintenance plan In this role, you will help in designing, analyzing, and building structures, machines, devices, systems, and mechanical processes for clients to meet their business process and application requirements. You will be working on program manufacturing for CNC machining, resolving problems through the application of acquired expertise guided by precedent. You will be working together with people from the business unit. Contacts are under the guidance and/or geared towards specifying activities, planning of activities, and giving explanations on technical issues. You will be working on monitoring project status, reporting metrics and research. You may also be expected to work on ESPRIT, CAM, NX & SOLIDWORKS.  What are we looking for? Mechanical Engineering  Adaptable and flexible  Ability to perform under pressure  Ability to work well in a team  Ability to meet deadlines  Claims Administration  Aftermarket Strategy  Warranty Management Roles and Responsibilities  In this role you are required to solve routine problems, largely through precedent and referral to general guidelines  Your expected interactions are within your own team and direct supervisor  You will be provided detailed to moderate level of instruction on daily work tasks and detailed instruction on new assignments  The decisions that you make would impact your own work  You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team, with a predetermined, focused scope of work  Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts

column2: Skill required:  Procurement Operations - Procurement Support Designation:  Procurement Practice Senior Analyst Qualifications: Any Graduation  Years of Experience: 5 to 8 years  Language - Ability: English - Advanced  What would you do? Vendor Admin team is responsible for Vendor Management that includes enabling suppliers in SAP, Ariba and Fieldglass. It also includes verifying vendor details through third party systems and engaging suppliers to transact electronically with Client What are we looking for? Required skills:Basic knowledge of SAP and Ariba Innovation Ability to adapt to change Ability to find creative and innovative ways to solve issues Operations Execution and Performance Measurement Ability to communicate efficiently with team and highlight issues that ae not resolved within the team Ability to resolve issues and conflicts and prioritize work requests Ability to identify root cause and provide issue resolution Perform advanced trouble shooting with suppliers. Ability to manage the quality, accuracy, and consistency of work products Job Management Make decisions and take necessary action to solve operational problems in BAU tasksAbility to work well in a dynamic and rapidly changing environment Driven to meeting and exceeding expectations Understanding of procurement-related financial analysesThought Leadership Excellent communication skills (verbal, written) skills required. Education Bachelor's Degree or equivalent  Procurement Support  Roles and Responsibilities:  Collaborate with different teams for completion of Vendor setup and maintenance in SAP, Ariba Buyer, Ariba Network and Fieldglass. Matching and Verify vendor details through third party systems such as Clear, Google, FRS & SWIFT site.Register suppliers in eProcurement systems for sourcing and contracting purposesRegular interactions with clients, sourcing managers and suppliers Collaborate with Ariba team to provide testing support for suppliers integrating with the Ariba Network Send Trading relationship requests to supplier to accept and transact electronically with AIG for transmitting POs and submit invoices Track the acceptance of Trading relationship by supplier to ensure the completion of supplier enablement process Qualification Any Graduation

column2: Role Description DB Vendor Management (VM) are responsible for maintaining a bank wide end to end VM framework. The Infrastructure Vendor Management Office (iVMO) is responsible for implementing key elements of the framework, therefore ensuring the most efficient and effective execution of any sourcing event in full compliance with Group policies and standards. The iVMO partners with the business functions maintain a full understanding of business priorities and requirements to lead to the best sourcing outcomes across the Bank. The iVMO manages the divisional contract and Vendor legal governance and contributes to the required group wide transparency on our key vendor partners to drive informed management decisions. Within the iVMO divisional setup is the the Strategy, MI & ELO pillar. The MI Specialist is responsible for Central MI across defined stakeholder groups, incl. KPI definitions and ensuring automated solutions in reporting & data analytics. The role of the MI team has evolved to a regular ongoing data provider function for critical management decisions for control of costs & FTE associated with CTB programs. The data is used to monitor various domains to ensure central control and consistency in the execution of programs. Furthermore, regulatory requirements on reporting require the enhancement of reporting KPIs to Regulators, ExCo and OpCo. The unit also provides data driven performance indicators for all the different areas of iVMO including Vendor Management, Risk, Business Partners, Strategy and Processes. Hence the tasks are include administrative, performance management, tracking and reporting. Your Key Responsibilities: Support the Head of the unit in cost and performance management related to the External Workforce, vendor landscape for the various divisional domains and key stakeholders in iVMO and TDI COO in a reliable manner. Ensure that the team fulfils its responsibilities of being the central function for key Cost management and MI requirements to senior stakeholders including the TDI ExCo, TDI OpCo and Head of iVMO Supporting the preparation of cost metrics for all areas of iVMO and the larger TDI domain Work with key stakeholders outside of iVMO in TDI COO, Procurement, Finance, Strategy and Performance Management to establish units cost management requirements Maintain full understanding of the divisional business priorities while ensuring Cost management & reporting adheres to DB internal processes and external regulator or auditor requirements. In partnership with Strategy, MI and ELO functions, responsible to evaluate and approve data analysis requirements and automation solutions. Your Skills & Experience: Significant IT Domain and business management experience with ability to drive through change programs Highly skilled in tools relevant for cost analytics Knowledge of systems, tools and processes for extraction and analysis of relevant cost data Relationship building and stakeholder management skill set Ability to diagnose improvement areas across processes, tools and systems Strong quantitative skills and orientation on managing complex datasets.

column11: Vendor Management, data analytics, data analysis, automation, cost analytics, business management

column2: As part of the Enterprise Sourcing Office (ESO) Relationship Management team, this role is primarily focused on supporting Vendor Relationship Manager category leads to improve overall vendor relationships with BNY Mellon s external third parties through consistent and standardized governance activities     As part of this role, you will be involved with various activities, including but not limited to, supporting Vendor Relationship Category leads in creating periodic business review, developing and maintaining performance reviews, developing detailed vendor profiles, and other various external third-party lifecycle activities     Support Vendor Relationship managers to Develop and maintain relationships with the BNY Mellon s third parties.     Support Vendor Relationship managers with monitoring the relationships with the BNY Mellon s third parties and determine ways to optimize the relationships, create a more satisfying experience, and help drive savings.     Support Vendor Relationship managers to Conduct regular reviews with the BNY Mellon's third parties to assess performance and drive reporting to meet on-going monitoring requirements.     Support Vendor Relationship Managers to create and maintain detailed vendor profiles.            To be successful in this role, we're seeking the following:           Bachelors degree in business administration, supply chain management, or a related field.     Strong communication skills to interact with vendors and internal stakeholders.     Basic understanding of procurement processes and vendor selection criteria.     Proficiency in using vendor management software or tools, is a plus.     Attention to detail and ability to track vendor performance and compliance.     Analytical skills to assess vendor performance metrics.     Ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure vendor objectives are met.     Familiarity with legal and regulatory requirements related to vendor contracts.     Prior experience in vendor management or procurement, even in internships or entry-level positions, is a plus.

column2: Human Resources are at the heart of Accenture, unleashing the power of talent in everything we do. We take pride in making a real impact on the careers and well-being of our people, and ensuring Accenture is one of the most inclusive and diverse organizations in the world. Join us as we pursue our ultimate ambitionto be the best place for the most highly specialized talent on the planet. Corporate Functionsincluding Human Resources, Finance, Legal, Marketing and Communications, and Workplace Solutions--offers the essential expertise that enables our more than 394,000 employees to deliver high performance to our clients. Be the engine that powers Accenture, a $31 billion company that provides consulting and outsourcing services to more than 40 industries--including 94 of the Fortune 100, and governments around the world Job Summary : Providing the voice of the GU TSC Service Delivery into the CoE, and supporting the implementation and run of TSC CoE best practices, tools and processes into the local GU TSC Service Delivery team  Building and nurturing seamless and collaborative relationships between interlocks and the GU's ensuring we are optimizing the TSC services being delivered to our businesses  Understanding the full end to end talent supply chain challenge, integrating the right parties globally and locally to obtain the right fit solution  Ensuring reporting and meetings meet the end objective of being easily understandable and actionable, and relevant to all parties exposed to them  Work to eliminate duplication, especially in reporting and commentary  Understanding key trends and emerging/current issues and providing relevant expertise to manage these ahead of the curve in a strategic fashion  TSC subject matter expert for the AAPAC DTE HR Business Partners and the business, providing AAPAC specific expertise and analysis (chargeability, staffing escalations, forecasting, hot spots) Collaborating with Global DTE TSC across all TSC initiatives Key responsibilities: Some schedule flexibility to participate in a global team, might require calls/meetings that accommodate multi global time zones Occasionally travel may be required  Effective oral and written communication skills  Strong leadership skills  Problem solving/research  Skilled in strategic thinking  Customer service/customer relationship management  Quality assurance/thoroughness  Creativity/innovation  Strong influence, negotiation skills  Comfortable working virtually  Collaborative, able to work across organizational entities Qualification Skills & Qualifications Required Must have: Undergraduate degree or equivalent work experience Good to have: HR certifications  OUR COMMITMENT TO YOU:  You'll benefit from our network of global communities and collaborative culture that will help you build technical and functional skills and capabilities. And because we serve more than 40 industries globally, you'll have the opportunity to develop valuable industry-specific expertise.  The scale of our capabilities and client engagementsand the unique way we innovate, operate and deliver valuewill give you the opportunity to deepen your existing skills even as you help create the latest technology trends.  You'll have access to leading-edge technology.CALL TO ACTION:If you have a desire to help the world's leading companies and governments, now's the time to join the world's largest and most diversified group of technology, business process and consulting professionals. Be part of a dynamic team of collaborative experts, and help us improve the way the world works and lives

column2: Skill required:  Sourcing & Procurement - Procurement Management Designation:  Business Advisory New Associate Qualifications: BCom/Any Graduation/Master of Business Administration  Years of Experience: 0 to 1 years  Language - Ability: English - Intermediate  What would you do? Go beyond processing purchase orders at lower costs to help clients reap savings and value from the billions they spend on the goods and services that run their day-to-day business operations. You will be working as a part of Procurement management team which uses a systematic approach for buying all the goods and services needed for a company to stay sustainable. They are involved in the identification of need, finding and qualifying the suppliers, requesting proposals, negotiating with suppliers, contracting, delivery and analyzing results.The Procurement Support team focuses on identifying the requirements for goods and services from all business units. The team is responsible for identifying and evaluating a list of suppliers, negotiating contracts with the selected supplier, raising a purchase requisition and releasing the purchase order. The team is also responsible for completing the payment process upon receiving an invoice, auditing the delivery of requested goods/services and maintaining proper records of invoices. What are we looking for? Procurement Operations Procurement Support Spot Buy Sourcing Ability to perform under pressure Agility for quick learning Commitment to quality Procurement Management Sourcing  Roles and Responsibilities: In this role you are required to solve routine problems, largely through precedent and referral to general guidelines Your primary interaction is within your own team and your direct supervisor In this role you will be given detailed instructions on all tasks The decisions that you make impact your own work and are closely supervised You will be an individual contributor as a part of a team with a predetermined, narrow scope of work Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts

column2: Job Summary ??This role is responsible for developing IT strategies aligned with a high-impact business agenda and collaborating with vendors and senior management to define information needs and sustain service levels. The role assists in managing IT spends and investments, resolving operational issues directly with clients, and serving as a representative of relevant stakeholders to ensure consistency in plans between IT and respective entities. The role identifies opportunities for leveraging standardized IT solutions and advocates for best practices. Responsibilities ??Develops and drives IT strategies to align with a high impact business agenda supporting the business segment, including the integration points between this function and other functional IT partners. ??Collaborates with vendors, industry consultants and senior company management to define information needs, develop cases and priorities, sustain service levels, and proactively lead business demands. ??Assists in managing spends and IT investments according to plan while ensuring timely work during budget and forecasts processes. ??Works directly with clients, internal or external, to resolve operational issues, utilizing technical expertise. ??Serves as a representative of the business, function, or geography, ensuring ongoing congruence in plans between IT and the respective entities. ??Identifies opportunities where the business, function, or geography can leverage standardized IT solutions and actively promotes their adoption. ??Cultivates and sustains relationships with pivotal tactical leaders and business implementation leads, leveraging extensive business acumen spanning multiple businesses or sub-domains to foster engagement in major IT endeavors. ??Advocates for the proliferation of best practices developed from interactions between businesses, functions, or geographies and other counterparts. ??Applies advanced subject matter knowledge, leads, and contributes to complex projects, and exercises independent judgment in resolving business issues and establishing policies. ??Education & Experience Recommended ??Four-year or Graduate Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or any other related discipline or commensurate work experience or demonstrated competence. ??Typically has 7-10 years of work experience, preferably in IT projects, process improvement, or a related field. Cross-Org Skills ??Effective Communication ??Results Orientation ??Learning Agility ??Digital Fluency ??Customer Centricity Impact & Scope ??Impacts function and leads and/or provides expertise to functional project teams and may participate in cross-functional initiatives. Complexity ??Works on complex problems where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of multiple factors. Shift - No shift premium (India)

column2: When you join Weatherford, you instantly feel connected to something bigger a community that is grounded by our core values and driven to create innovative solutions for our customers. We celebrate each other s successes, grow together, and learn from each other constantly. Individually, we are impressive. Together, we are unstoppable. We are One Weatherford.          Weatherford offers competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits program and provides you a challenging and enriching career path, with a healthy balance of structure and flexibility to chart your own course.          Weatherford is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.          Responsibilities                Should have 3 to 6 years experience in inventory management with negotiation, supplier set up/management, maintaining inventory data, ITR.          Qualification- B.E/B.Tech Mechanical, Industrial engineering          Ability to multi-task          Proficient in basic computer skills          Strong oral and written communication skills          Excellent organizational skills          Should be able to work closely and collaboratively with fellow employees                Qualifications                Our Asset and Inventory Coordinator is responsible for coordinating inventory levels        Day to day you will be providing information to determine the status of current orders and to forecast needs for future orders      You will compile documentation of materials and stock on hand, monitor reorder points and initiate action to replenish stock as needed               Responsibilities and Duties:            MOOWR data submission : Using ERP system-get last month invoicing data from the system and create report of actual used BOM /LOT numbet/Qty and verify the same with imported parts received agains MOOWR license.          Use of material planning (MRP/DRP) reports to determine and review supply requirements needed to support the business and/or production demand, including outside processes where needed          Develop and maintain a comprehensive understanding of the technical specifications of products and services procured. Work closely with engineering teams to interpret technical drawings, requirements, and standards          Reviews purchase requisitions raised by Departments, obtaining necessary information includingtechnical specifications and required delivery date          Inventory Redeployment Check to use existing inventory          Utilize Contract Pricing where available          Requests quotes from suppliers on items needed for branch operations to required specifications and communicates delivery need          Evaluates supplier response for accuracy of quote, as well as pricing and delivery requirements          Utilizes competitive bidding competencies, targeting the best quality, delivery, and total cost of ownership          Receive acknowledgement and updates anticipated delivery dates per communication with supplier and receiving/ordering branch          Monitors for Change Management Requirement Updates Purchase Order to add/adjust freight charges, PO amendments and any other changes affecting the accuracy and maintenance of the order to ensure alignment on expected delivery date          Acts as a liaison between the supplier and Source to Pay functions to resolve issues affecting timely payment, including Supplier requirements, Received Not Vouchered , Shipped not received/Import tracking          Facilitates or assists in supplier contract negotiations, as required , Participates in supplier review process and develop relationships with identified key strategic suppliers          Supports supplier base rationalization by working closely with Sourcing and Category Management          Discern supplier relationship needs based on transaction type.; Leverage relationship to aid in on-time delivery, product development, operational efficiencies, and overall performance
